decision.reasoning:
My entire strategy is built on reacting decisively to breaking news, and the injury report contains a bombshell. The New England Patriots' starting quarterback, Drake Maye, is listed as DNP (Did Not Practice) due to a right shoulder injury AND an illness. This is happening just days before the Super Bowl.

A starting quarterback not practicing this late in the week is a catastrophic development. Even if he plays, a shoulder injury will impact his throwing, and the illness will sap his strength and focus. The quarterback is the single most important position in football, and the Patriots' QB1 is severely compromised.

While the market has already priced the Seahawks as heavy favorites at 68.6%, I believe it is *underreacting* to the severity of this news. A compromised or backup quarterback drastically reduces a team's chances of winning the Super Bowl. ESPN's analytics put the Seahawks at 59.6%, but that model may not have fully weighted a DNP status this close to gametime. The Seahawks having a long injury list is a concern, but the specificity and importance of the Patriots' QB injury outweighs it.

This is the exact type of high-impact, late-breaking information I look for. The price is high, but the probability of a Seahawks win against a team with a non-practicing QB is even higher. I'm making a big, aggressive move on this news.

search_results.query: Super Bowl LX pregame warmup Drake Maye Geno Smith status

results.title: Super Bowl 60: Where to watch, kickoff time and everything you need to know

results.title: Patriots hold first official practice of Super Bowl week, Drake Maye "feeling great" - CBS Boston
results.snippet: The New England Patriots officially practiced for the first time on Wednesday ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks. Among those on the field at Stanford University was quarterback Drake Maye, who was limited all of last week with a shoulder injury and missed Friday's session with an illness.

results.title: Super Bowl LX injury report: Updates on Drake Maye's right shoulder, Sam Darnold's oblique, more - CBS Sports
results.snippet: Seahawks: Seattle had perfect attendance at practice, but did have several players limited: Quarterback Sam Darnold (oblique), offensive tackle Charles Cross (foot), safety Nick Emmanwori (ankle), offensive tackle Josh Jones (ankle, knee), linebacker Demarcus Lawrence (rest), fullback Robbie Ouzts (neck), receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba (rest), and defensive end Leonard Williams (rest). Patriots: Linebacker Robert Spillane (ankle) did not practice on Wednesday due to an ankle injury. However, he did tell the Boston Herald earlier in the day that he's "100% confident" that he'll be able to play in Super Bowl LX. Meanwhile, linebacker Harold Landry (knee) and offensive tackle Thayer Munford Jr. were both limited with knee injuries. Maybe the most important development on the injury front for New England comes at quarterback as the team listed Drake Maye (right shoulder) as a full participant.

decision.reasoning:
This news is decidedly negative for the Seattle Seahawks' chances of winning. The confirmation of Drake Maye's full health is a major boost for the Patriots, solidifying their offensive capabilities. A healthy starting QB for the favorite is a significant development.

Conversely, having two starting offensive tackles banged up is a major red flag for the Seahawks. Facing a Super Bowl-level defense with a potentially compromised offensive line is a recipe for disaster for quarterback Geno Smith and the entire offense.

While the market price of 12.7% is already low, this fresh, concrete news solidifies the Patriots' position as heavy favorites. The combination of the favorite's key question mark being resolved positively and a new weakness appearing for the underdog warrants a strong move against the Seahawks. My current position is heavily invested in a Seahawks win, and this news directly contradicts that thesis. I must aggressively trade to correct my position based on this new reality.
decision.raw:
<new_information>
The most material new information is the final confirmation of the key players' health status from the official injury reports. For the New England Patriots, quarterback Drake Maye, who was previously a concern due to a shoulder injury and an illness, has been a full participant in practice and is confirmed to be starting. This removes the primary uncertainty surrounding the favored team.

For the Seattle Seahawks, while they had "perfect attendance" at practice, two starting offensive linemen, Charles Cross (foot) and Josh Jones (ankle, knee), were listed as limited participants. This suggests the Seahawks' offensive line will not be at 100% strength.
</new_information>

<reasoning>
